metadata.author: Shi Zhao, Peihua Cao, Daozhou Gao, Zian Zhuang, Marc KC Chong, Yongli Cai, Jinjun Ran, Kai Wang, Lin Yang, Daihai He, Maggie H. Wang
metadata.title: Epidemic Growth and Reproduction Number for the Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Outbreak on the Diamond Princess Cruise Ship from January 20 to February 19, 2020: A preliminary Data-Driven Analysis
affiliations: The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK) - School of Public Health and Primary Care
National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant Number 61672013) and Huaian Key Laboratory for Infectious Diseases Control and Prevention (Grant Number HAP201704), Huaian, Jiangsu, China.
metadata.abstract: The COVID-19 outbreak on the Diamond Princess ship has caused over 600 (still increasing) cases as of February 19, 2020. By using the growing process model, we demonstrated that this Diamond Princess cruise outbreak implies a short serial interval of COVID-19. Hence, timely contact tracing and effectively quarantine were crucial to shutoff the COVID-19 transmission.

WW was supported by National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant Number 61672013) and Huaian Key Laboratory for Infectious Diseases Control and Prevention (Grant Number HAP201704), Huaian, Jiangsu, China. Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=3543150 or http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.3543150  SSRN Rankings  About SSRN We use cookies to help provide and enhance our service and tailor content.By continuing, you agree to the use of cookies. Abstract: The COVID-19 outbreak on the Diamond Princess ship has caused over 600 (still increasing) cases as of February 19, 2020. By using the growing process model, we demonstrated that this Diamond Princess cruise outbreak implies a short serial interval of COVID-19. Hence, timely contact tracing and effectively quarantine were crucial to shutoff the COVID-19 transmission.

Funding: DH was supported by General Research Fund (Grant Number 15205119) of the Research Grants Council (RGC) of Hong Kong, China. WW was supported by National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant Number 61672013) and Huaian Key Laboratory for Infectious Diseases Control and Prevention (Grant Number HAP201704), Huaian, Jiangsu, China.

Zhao, Shi and Cao, Peihua and Gao, Daozhou and Zhuang, Zian and Chong, Marc KC and Cai, Yongli and Ran, Jinjun and Wang, Kai and Yang, Lin and He, Daihai and Wang, Maggie H., Epidemic Growth and Reproduction Number for the Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Outbreak on the Diamond Princess Cruise Ship from January 20 to February 19, 2020: A Preliminary Data-Driven Analysis (February 20, 2020). Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=3543150 or http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.3543150

Timely contact tracing and effectively quarantine were crucial to shutoff the COVID-19 transmission.
